entry.title: Reland "Make network service sandbox be AppContainer not LPAC, for now."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 9e343358c7f7f01f96c473f9962bbc23cb5463c8



This CL updates the test to correctly support the new feature flag.



Original change's description:

> Make network service sandbox be AppContainer not LPAC, for now.

>

> This CL adds a new feature (disabled by default) that determines

> whether or not LPAC is enabled for the network service sandbox.

>

> It has been determined that Network Location Awareness service

> requires ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES (AppContainer) rather than

> ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES (LPAC) to connect to it,

> causing GetNetworkList to fail.

>

> This CL adds a temporaily weaker sandbox in order to make progress

> on other network service sandbox blockers.

>

> This feature will be enabled again once GetNetworkList has been

> proxied out via mojo.

>

> BUG=1450754

>

> Change-Id: I42d923f676776471a46e6d246e41f90b773416ee

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4708168

> Reviewed-by: James Forshaw

> Commit-Queue: Will Harris

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173691}



BUG=1450754

entry.title: Prerender UKM: NavigationRequest ukm::SourceId for prerendering
entry.content:
Currently, Navigation::GetPreviousPageUkmSourceId() returns an ID

that will not be associated with any URL while prerendering.

This behavior follows the data collection policy.



This patch clarifies the behavior in the method comment, and makes

it return kInvalidSourceId instead of other invalid runtime IDs.

This is a preparation to disallow to call GetPageUkmSourceId

for prerendering frames.



Bug: 1245014

entry.title: borealis: Fix the await task to complete synchronously
entry.content:
This bug is caused by subscription_ still having default value when the

SessionTracker synchronously invokes the callback. We fix it by removing

the check on the subscription.



Checking the subscription was just a trick to avoid double-calling

complete, but that isn't really a problem since complete moves the

callback.



We *did* have a test for this case but, unlike its name suggests, the

container isn't actually there before we add the callback. Fix this and

add an assert.



Bug: None

entry.title: shimless_rma: Add method to prepare app profile
entry.content:
Add a method to ShimlessRMA delegate to prepare the profile for showing

3p diagnostics. It will create the profile, install the extension crx

file, install the IWA swbn file, and return the results.

This method is also responsible to check if the extension and the IWA

are by the system.

entry.title: WebNN: Define average and max pool2d operators in mojo.
entry.content:
The pool2d is to compute a mean or max reduction operation across all

the elements within the moving window over the input tensor.



Validate the pool2d operators with converting the attributes from mojo

to component library type and add unit tests to verify to the graph

from renderer process.

entry.title: [Welcome Tour] Handle the actions that change the session state
entry.content:
This CL ensures that the accelerator actions that modify the session

states, such as the lock screen action, are handled properly.



When `WelcomeTourAcceleratorHandler` receives these accelerator

actions, the running tour is aborted. Meanwhile, these actions

continue to perform as usual.

entry.title: Add V8_LOW_PRIORITY_TQ for main thread
entry.content:
Latest V8 platform API supports specifying TaskPriority when getting a

foreground task runner [1]. This CL adds a new task queue with low

priority on main thread, and will be used for

v8::TaskPriority::kUserVisible.

entry.title: App Management: Remove PreferredAppsList reference to avoid UAF in tests
entry.content:
App Management uses the PreferredAppsList from App Service to listen to

and modify preferred apps settings. In Lacros tests which use a real Ash

process, App Service is reset between tests, and so the stored reference

to PreferredAppsList can become invalid when App Service restarts.



As a simple fix, we change App Management to read the PreferredAppsList

from App Service every time it is needed.



Note that I haven't been able to reliably figure out which Lacros test

is starting App Management, it seems like it might be flaky, which is in

itself a bit worrying.



Bug: 1466885

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Apply relevance penalty to fuzzy suggestions after ml.
entry.content:
The fuzzy provider works by running the bookmark and history quick

providers with a "corrected" input and applying a penalty proportional

to the correction amount to the results. The scoring signals are

populated according to the correct input and leads to an artificially

inflated model output.



This CL attempts to correct for this by applying the same penalty to

fuzzy suggestions post-rescoring using the model results. This is a

relatively quick and dirty solution that allows us to continue testing

for now without having to re-introduce new signals and retrain the model.



Bug: 1466606,1405555

entry.content:
video_encode_accelerator_(perf_)tests, with --reverse option, encodes

the consecutive frames. But in the reverse point, the identical frames

are encoded. The purpose of --reverse option is to make the encoded

video consecutive as encoded frames are consecutive in practical.

However, the back-to-back identical frames are not practical either.

This CL fixes the reverse algorithm.

entry.title: Don't throw exceptions on unknown codecs or unsupported sizes.
entry.content:
Per spec isConfigSupported() should only throw a TypeError for

invalid configs. An unrecognized codec string doesn't mean the

config is invalid. Even a malformed codec string may just be

a newer standard of a given string.



Instead the spec says we should mark the codec as unsupported

when resolving the isConfigSupported() promise and throw a

NotSupportedError DOMException if that config is given to

configure().



This includes a couple of related changes:

- Chromium now handles missing displayWidth and displayHeight.

- Exceeding Chromium specific bounds reports unsupported.



Unfortunately the web tests weren't quite testing the behavior

required by the spec, so this updates them to do so.



Fixes https://github.com/web-platform-tests/interop/issues/382



Fixed: 1457252

Change-Id: Id6b82dd09fdcb0d389429de15a6b23f6b6e5f56a

entry.title: [omnibox][webui] Wait only if needed on first access; measure init times
entry.content:
This CL eliminates the handler wait in the webui omnibox popup ctor and

instead blocks on first handler access, only if necessary. In practice

with this design, the wait is expected to be needed rarely if ever

because the handler generally has time to initialize and bind the remote

before the user's first interaction with the omnibox. Since very quick

omnibox access might request the handler before it's ready, we check for

this case and wait as needed. Any waits have their durations recorded,

and this metric is complemented with omnibox first access time

measurement so that we can clearly see the tradeoff.



Bug: 1396174

Change-Id: I4d8519284250400a8435aa5a953023d5fc03fbca

entry.content:

a bypass for the argument filtering.



This should be a useful for any 32-bit ChromeOS devices still being

updated, any 32-bit Linux Chromium build, and a future Android seccomp

policy for the network service (for the Android emulator).

entry.title: [Feature Engagement] Propagate test IPH configuration to child processes
entry.content:
There are test jobs (e.g. browser_tests_require_lacros) where the tests

are run in a browser that is external to the test executable.



In those cases, even if the test disables IPH by default (which is the

default behavior for tests), and even if it then re-enables specific

IPH, the child browser process knows none of this. This can result in

spurious help bubbles appearing in the external browser, which can

interfere with tests. We have already seen this with the ChromeVox tests.



This CL:

- Organizes all test-specific info about IPH enabling/disabling

into a single, thread-safe data structure.

- Provides a way to pass that data on to child processes during tests.

- Specifically uses this new functionality when launching an external

browser via crosapi.



These changes should have very little impact and effectively be no-ops

during normal browser operation.



The attached bug is likely related, at least in part. katie@ has

reported seeing help bubbles briefly appearing during ChromeVox tests

even in the current codebase.



Bug: b/262789941

Change-Id: I47e903118fe9cd89cdd2d687d27b04285127964a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4718652

entry.title: Fix cloning of templates with DOM Parts, and improve testing
entry.content:
This CL improves the testing of template cloning with Parts, testing

these four cases:



1. Main document parsing

2. Template (content fragment) parsing

3. Template/fragment cloning

4. Declarative Shadow DOM parsing and cloning



This CL fixes the behavior for #3 above, but leaves #4 broken. The

following changes in behavior are made:



1. Part::MoveToRoot() can be used to change the root(), including

to set it to nullptr. This happens when a Node tree is removed

from the DOM, and it contains Parts that refer to the old root.

2. IsDocumentPartRoot() is now virtual, because during a tree move,

the root() for a Part can be made nullptr even when it's a

ChildNodePart.

3. Part::disconnected_ is added to keep track of whether the

Part has been disconnected, since root() can now be nullptr.

4. (This is a bug fix) When using ChildNodePart::setNextSibling(),

the new sibling node wasn't having its Part registered with

NodeRareData, which caused a CHECK failure when trying to

subsequently clone that Part. This is caught in the new test

which clones declaratively-built templates containing Parts.



Bug: 1453291

Change-Id: Ic1c1475431cf6bd658f191db78003204412ef78f

Metrics collection only needs to discover a few adapters on the system,

instead of all of the adapters displayed in about://gpu.

finding more adapters.

entry.title: arc-a11y: Clear AXTreeSourceAndroid::Hook when root window changes
entry.content:
We have AXTreeSourceAndroid::Hook to keep some state across events.

The hook instance is attached to a node ID, but it's possible that the

same node ID is reused when the root window id has been changed. We

should clear the list of hooks when it happens, otherwise we may

accidentally keep stale states.



This fixes DCHECK failure in AutoCompleteHandler::PostSerializeNode.

entry.title: Revert "Remove redundant existence check in PathService"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5ed59357a82db71fc98993f96dd5111411529e36.



Reason for revert: Tests are failing because a folder fetched by PathService::Get call seems to be missing when setting up a the javascript browser tests.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/19934/overview

This was the only CL that seemed relevant. Unable to test locally and will try reverting.



Original change's description:

> Remove redundant existence check in PathService

>

> Callers of PathService::OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded may ask it to ensure

> that the given path exists as a directory. Chrome's

> InitializeUserDataDir uses this to set the path for

> chrome::DIR_USER_DATA on the basis of command line or enterprise policy

> options. Since base::CreateDirectory itself will return true if the

> given path already exists as a directory, and will return false if the

> given path either names a file or such a directory cannot be created,

> there is no need for OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded to make any checks on the

> path before calling CreateDirectory. Doing so is only wasted I/O and can

> lead to filesystem races.

>

> Bug: 1336338

> Change-Id: If0b910f90ce5d89af56731edd6fb7d0787124a6d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685555

> Reviewed-by: Francois Pierre Doray

> Commit-Queue: Francois Pierre Doray

> Auto-Submit: Greg Thompson

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175536}



Bug: 1336338

entry.title: [lacros] Fix GetPrimaryUserProfile crash on signin
entry.content:
This change fixes a crash that happens when Ash is restarted

before the session is initialized (e.g. when applying some flags).



Normally, Lacros would not be running at that point, but when

prelaunching at login screen, it is, which causes the termination

handler to try and update the LoginPref, when the profile is

not yet available.



This CL adds an additional check that only updates the LoginPref

if the primary user's profile is available.



TEST=Triggered Ash restart with prelaunch flag enabled

BUG=1439970



Change-Id: If5be0a972915b44cbc93ad3d6ae977b513469c1d

entry.title: Replace SkiaGoldPixelDiff ctor with a getter that reuses sessions
entry.content:
This CL replaces explicit constructing of SkiaGoldPixelDiff with an API

get or create and initialize existing sessions. This is useful because

the initialization of SkiaGoldPixelDiff is expensive and modifying test

suites to initialize sessions once per suite is cumbersome.



Some behavioral changes:

- No longer possible to have an uninitialized SkiaGoldPixelDiff since

they cannot be directly instantiated.

- SkiaGoldPixelDiff now takes the full golden image name. Callers need

to keep track of the prefix and suffix.

- SkiaGoldPixelDiff is now final, so any test helpers that extended it

now own an pointer to a session.

- The default corpus and test environment is considered part of the

session key, even though it is implicitly added.

- No longer passes --dryrun to the auth call.

- No longer initialize DCompPresenterSkiaGoldPixelDiff during test suite

setup, it's now on the first pixel diff test.



Change-Id: I7fa52d5943b14fcd9a557a5785e5e4cee924c162

entry.title: Discard transient framebuffer attachments only upon composite.
entry.content:
WebGL's DrawingBuffer was incorrectly discarding transient framebuffer

attachments (the depth and stencil buffers for the default framebuffer

with preserveDrawingBuffer:false) when resolving a multisampled

default framebuffer on behalf of public entry points. This was exposed

by the fix for Issue angleproject:8228 through failures of the

conformance/context/context-attributes-alpha-depth-stencil-antialias.html

test, and explains other preexisting failures of this test.



Refactor the internal resolution methods to distinguish between

resolves for the compositor, and for public APIs.



Fixed: 1467393

entry.title: cellular: Fix FeatureUsageMetrics for eSIM
entry.content:
This change fixes the FeatureUsageMetrics for eSIM so that both the

IsEligible() and IsEnabled() implementations use the same source of

truth for determining their return. Previously the IsEnabled() method

relied on device prefs that cached the eSIM state while IsEligible

directly checked whether an EUICC was available; this breaks down in the

situation where the EUICC might not be available, e.g. Hermes is down,

but we still have cached eSIM profiles.



Bug: b/291812699

Test: Manually verified on a Linux build.

entry.title: multipaste: Populate clipboard history items with URL titles when found
entry.content:
This CL updates the clipboard history resource manager to query the

primary user profile's browsing history for a page title when the user

copies a URL. If a title is found, the corresponding clipboard history

item's secondary display text is set to that title.

entry.title: Revert "[FedCM] Use CCT for showModalDialog() part 2"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0a9da4878ebe71aa3521634715ede94e1ac3ed3d.



Reason for revert: failing on arm64 bots



Original change's description:

> [FedCM] Use CCT for showModalDialog() part 2

>

> This CL finalizes Android support for the IDP sign-in via a CCT. The

> flow is a bit different from desktop:

> 1. showModalDialog() is invoked on the opener, which launches a CCT.

> This also adds an ActivityStateObserver to detect when the CCT has

> been closed. We also notify the AccountSelectionMediator to ensure

> that it does not attempt to show the bubble while the CCT is open.

> 2. closeModalDialog() is invoked on the CCT directly, so that we may

> query the delegate using the static mapping and the FedCM ID of the

> intent. We call onModalDialogClosed() on the opener, which notifies

> the mediator and cancels the activity observer. When the opener

> becomes interactable again, we will show the FedCM UI.

> 3. If the CCT is instead closed some other way, the opener is notified

> via onActivityResumed(), so that it may invoke onDismissed() to send

> the termination of the flow to the JavaScript API.

>

> To make this change work:

> * We now receive the WebContents in the creator of

> IdentityRequestDialogController instead of the individual methods, as

> we want it on CloseModalDialog() in the Android case.

> * We no longer attempt to destroy and recreate the Java Bridge when a

> show method is invoked. This is so that the object which receives the

> second show (once the IDP signin occurs and the second accounts fetch

> happens) is the same as the first one, and the flow works as intended.

>

> Bug: 1456368

> Change-Id: I62d19661560154b818e6c8f733955f291f7eb0de

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4708206

> Reviewed-by: Christian Biesinger

> Reviewed-by: John Abd-El-Malek

> Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

> Commit-Queue: Nicols Pea

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175483}



Bug: 1456368, 1467957

Change-Id: Ibc7f85dbc9c4cf96773397e33c639b5370d036dc

entry.title: Fix crash in PreloadingAttemptImpl::SetFailureReason.
entry.content:
The check in PreloadingAttemptImpl::SetFailureReason that

failure_reason_ is PreloadingFailureReason::kUnspecified was failing,

meaning that the failure reason was already set. The only way for this

occur is for a PrefetchContainer to have its status set to

PrefetchStatus::kPrefetchNotUsedCookiesChanged multiple times.



This CL fixes this issue by resetting the streaming URL loaders after

setting the status of a PrefetchContainer to

PrefetchStatus::kPrefetchNotUsedCookiesChanged, therefore marking it as

not servable.
